rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.STUDYID

classVariable.definition: A sequence of characters used by the sponsor to uniquely identify the study.
classVariable.label: Study Identifier
classVariable.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.DOMAIN

classVariable.definition: An abbreviation for a collection of observations, with a topic-specific commonality.
classVariable.label: Domain Abbreviation
classVariable.name: DOMAIN
classVariable.notes: 2-character abbreviation. The domain abbreviation is also used as a prefix for variables to ensure uniqueness when datasets are merged.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.USUBJID

classVariable.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
classVariable.label: Unique Subject Identifier
classVariable.name: USUBJID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.POOLID

classVariable.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify a group of subjects that have been pooled together.
classVariable.label: Pool Identifier
classVariable.name: POOLID
classVariable.notes: Used for results that are not assignable to a specific subject.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.SPDEVID

classVariable.definition: A sequence of characters used by the sponsor to uniquely identify a specific device.
classVariable.label: Sponsor Device Identifier
classVariable.name: SPDEVID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.SPTOBID

classVariable.definition: A sequence of characters used by the applicant to uniquely identify a tobacco product.
classVariable.label: Applicant-Defined Tobacco Product ID
classVariable.name: SPTOBID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.IGDCMPID

classVariable.definition: A sequence of characters used by the applicant to uniquely identify an ingredient, substance or component of a tobacco product.
classVariable.label: Ingredient or Component Identifier
classVariable.name: IGDCMPID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.STOCONID

classVariable.definition: A sequence of characters used by the applicant to uniquely identify a set of environmental conditions under which a product was stored.
classVariable.label: Applicant-defined Storage Conditions ID
classVariable.name: STOCONID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.NHOID

classVariable.label: Non-Host Organism Identifier
classVariable.name: NHOID
classVariable.notes: Sponsor-defined identifier for a non-host organism. This variable should be populated with an intuitive name based on the identity of the non-host organism as reported by the lab.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.FETUSID

classVariable.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify a fetus associated with a maternal subject, for a particular prenatal evaluation.
classVariable.label: Fetus Identifier
classVariable.name: FETUSID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.FOCID

classVariable.examples: A drug application site (e.g., "Injection site 1", "Biopsy site 1", "Treated site 1"), or a more specific focus (e.g., "OD" (right eye), "Upper left quadrant of the back")
classVariable.label: Focus of Study-Specific Interest
classVariable.name: FOCID
classVariable.notes: Identification of a focus of study-specific interest on or within a subject or specimen as called out in the protocol for which a measurement, test, or examination was performed. The value in this variable should have inherent semantic meaning.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--SEQ

classVariable.definition: A number used in combination with the identifier of the subject of the observation to uniquely identify a record within a domain.
classVariable.label: Sequence Number
classVariable.name: --SEQ
classVariable.notes: May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1. Datasets that do not contain subject data, such as the Trial Summary (TS) domain and the Device Tracking (DT) domains, use --SEQ as a sequence number to ensure uniqueness within the dataset.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--GRPID

classVariable.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify related records for a subject within a domain, or related parameters in the TS dataset.
classVariable.label: Group ID
classVariable.name: --GRPID
classVariable.notes: See also Section 5.1.6, Trial Summary Information and Section 5.1.7, Challenge Agent Characterization.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--REFID

classVariable.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify a source of information.
classVariable.examples: A lab specimen ID, the UUID for an ECG waveform or a medical image.
classVariable.label: Reference ID
classVariable.name: --REFID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--RECID

classVariable.label: Invariant Record Identifier
classVariable.name: --RECID
classVariable.notes: Identifier for a record that is unique within a domain for a study and that remains invariant through subsequent versions of the dataset, even if the content of the record is modified. When a record is deleted, this value must not be reused to identify another record in either the current or future versions of the domain.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--SPID

classVariable.definition: A sponsor-defined sequence of characters used to identify an instance of an observation.
classVariable.examples: A preprinted line identifier on a Concomitant Medications form.
classVariable.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
classVariable.name: --SPID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--LNKID

classVariable.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify a record, for a subject, in one domain and link it to 1 or more records for that subject in another domain.
classVariable.examples: A value that links a single tumor to multiple measurements/assessments performed at different times.
classVariable.label: Link ID
classVariable.name: --LNKID
classVariable.notes: This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--LNKGRP

classVariable.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify a group of records, for a subject, in one domain and link it to 1 or more records for that subject in another domain.
classVariable.examples: A value that links multiple tumor measurement/assessments to a single response to therapy.
classVariable.label: Link Group ID
classVariable.name: --LNKGRP
classVariable.notes: This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--BEATNO

classVariable.label: ECG Beat Number
classVariable.name: --BEATNO
classVariable.notes: A sequence number that identifies the beat within an ECG.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.VISITNUM

classVariable.definition: An assigned numeric identifier that aligns to the chronological order of a clinical encounter.
classVariable.label: Visit Number
classVariable.name: VISITNUM
classVariable.notes: Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting. VISITNUM does not have to be an integer value.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.VISIT

classVariable.definition: The label for a protocol-defined clinical encounter.
classVariable.label: Visit Name
classVariable.name: VISIT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.VISITDY

classVariable.definition: The planned study day of a clinical encounter relative to the sponsor-defined reference start date.
classVariable.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
classVariable.name: VISITDY
classVariable.notes: Should be an integer.

priorVersion.title: Planned Order of Element Within Arm

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.TAETORD

self.title: Planned Order of Element Within Arm

classVariable.definition: An assigned numeric identifier that gives the planned order of the element within the trial arm of the study.
classVariable.label: Planned Order of Element Within Arm
classVariable.name: TAETORD
classVariable.notes: See Section 5.1.1.2, Trial Arms.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.EPOCH

classVariable.definition: A time period defined in the protocol with a study-specific purpose.
classVariable.label: Epoch
classVariable.name: EPOCH
classVariable.notes: The epoch associated with an observation is determined by the start date or start date and time of the observation, or the date/time of collection if start date/time is not collected (see Section 5.1.1.2, Trial Arms).

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.RPHASE

classVariable.label: Repro Phase
classVariable.name: RPHASE
classVariable.notes: Reproductive phase with which the reproductive stage of the reproductive path is associated. Defined in Trial Paths domain. The RPHASE variable is Required when any Reproductive Phase Day variable is used.

priorVersion.title: Planned Repro Phase Day of Observation

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.RPPLDY

self.title: Planned Repro Phase Day of Observation

classVariable.definition: The day within the reproductive phase on which the test or observation was scheduled to occur.
classVariable.label: Planned Repro Phase Day of Observation
classVariable.name: RPPLDY
classVariable.notes: Expressed as an integer.

priorVersion.title: Planned Repro Phase Day of Obs Start

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.RPPLSTDY

self.title: Planned Repro Phase Day of Obs Start

classVariable.definition: The day within the reproductive phase on which the test or observation was scheduled to begin.
classVariable.label: Planned Repro Phase Day of Obs Start
classVariable.name: RPPLSTDY
classVariable.notes: Expressed as an integer.

priorVersion.title: Planned Repro Phase Day of Obs End

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.RPPLENDY

self.title: Planned Repro Phase Day of Obs End

classVariable.definition: The day within the reproductive phase on which the test or observation was scheduled to end.
classVariable.label: Planned Repro Phase Day of Obs End
classVariable.name: RPPLENDY
classVariable.notes: Expressed as an integer.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--DTC

classVariable.definition: The date or date and time of the assessment or the specimen or data collection from the subject, represented in a standardized character format.
classVariable.label: Date/Time of Collection
classVariable.name: --DTC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--STDTC

classVariable.definition: The start date or date and time of an intervention or event, represented in a standardized character format.
classVariable.label: Start Date/Time of Observation
classVariable.name: --STDTC
classVariable.notes: The start date of a Findings class record is stored in the --DTC variable.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--ENDTC

classVariable.definition: The end date or date and time of an intervention, event, or finding, represented in a standardized character format.
classVariable.label: End Date/Time of Observation
classVariable.name: --ENDTC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--DY

classVariable.definition: The number of days from the sponsor-defined reference start date to the date of collection (--DTC), used in study data tabulation.
classVariable.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
classVariable.name: --DY
classVariable.notes: The sponsor-defined reference start date is RFSTDTC in Demographics.

priorVersion.title: Study Day of Start of Observation

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--STDY

self.title: Study Day of Start of Observation

classVariable.definition: The number of days from the sponsor-defined reference start date to the start of an intervention or event (--STDTC), used for study data tabulation.
classVariable.label: Study Day of Start of Observation
classVariable.name: --STDY
classVariable.notes: The sponsor-defined reference start date is RFSTDTC in Demographics.

priorVersion.title: Study Day of End of Observation

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--ENDY

self.title: Study Day of End of Observation

classVariable.definition: The number of days from the sponsor-defined reference start date to the end of an intervention, event, or finding (--ENDTC), used for study data tabulation.
classVariable.label: Study Day of End of Observation
classVariable.name: --ENDY
classVariable.notes: The sponsor-defined reference start date is RFSTDTC in Demographics.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--NOMDY

classVariable.definition: The nominal study day, relative to the sponsor-defined reference start date, used by data collection and reporting systems for grouping records for observations that may be scheduled to occur on different days into a single study day (e.g., for output on a tabulation report).
classVariable.label: Nominal Study Day for Tabulations
classVariable.name: --NOMDY

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--NOMLBL

classVariable.definition: The name for a protocol-defined nominal study day.
classVariable.label: Label for Nominal Study Day
classVariable.name: --NOMLBL
classVariable.notes: As presented in the study report.

priorVersion.title: Actual Repro Phase Day of Observation

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--RPDY

self.title: Actual Repro Phase Day of Observation

classVariable.definition: The day within the reproductive phase on which the test or observation occurred.
classVariable.label: Actual Repro Phase Day of Observation
classVariable.name: --RPDY
classVariable.notes: Expressed as an integer.

priorVersion.title: Actual Repro Phase Day of Obs Start

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--RPSTDY

self.title: Actual Repro Phase Day of Obs Start

classVariable.definition: The day within the reproductive phase on which the test or observation began.
classVariable.label: Actual Repro Phase Day of Obs Start
classVariable.name: --RPSTDY
classVariable.notes: Expressed as an integer.

priorVersion.title: Actual Repro Phase Day of Obs End

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--RPENDY

self.title: Actual Repro Phase Day of Obs End

classVariable.definition: The day within the reproductive phase on which the test or observation ended.
classVariable.label: Actual Repro Phase Day of Obs End
classVariable.name: --RPENDY
classVariable.notes: Expressed as an integer.

priorVersion.title: Day of Obs Relative to Exposure

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--XDY

self.title: Day of Obs Relative to Exposure

classVariable.label: Day of Obs Relative to Exposure
classVariable.name: --XDY
classVariable.notes: The actual study day of an intervention, event, or finding, derived relative to the first exposure to any protocol-specified treatment or product. Expressed in integer days relative to RFXSTDTC in Demographics.

priorVersion.title: Start Day of Obs Relative to Exposure

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--XSTDY

self.title: Start Day of Obs Relative to Exposure

classVariable.label: Start Day of Obs Relative to Exposure
classVariable.name: --XSTDY
classVariable.notes: The actual study day of the start of an intervention or event, derived relative to the first exposure to any protocol-specified treatment or product. Expressed in integer days relative to RFXSTDTC in Demographics.

priorVersion.title: End Day of Obs Relative to Exposure

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--XENDY

self.title: End Day of Obs Relative to Exposure

classVariable.label: End Day of Obs Relative to Exposure
classVariable.name: --XENDY
classVariable.notes: The actual study day of the end of an intervention, event, or finding, derived relative to the first exposure to any protocol-specified treatment or product. Expressed in integer days relative to RFXSTDTC in Demographics.

priorVersion.title: Day of Obs Rel to Challenge Agent

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--CHDY

self.title: Day of Obs Rel to Challenge Agent

classVariable.label: Day of Obs Rel to Challenge Agent
classVariable.name: --CHDY
classVariable.notes: The actual study day of an intervention, event, or finding, derived relative to the first exposure to the challenge agent that induces the disease or condition that the investigational treatment is intended to cure, mitigate, treat, or prevent. Expressed in integer days relative to RFCSTDTC in Demographics.

priorVersion.title: Start Day of Obs Rel to Challenge Agent

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--CHSTDY

self.title: Start Day of Obs Rel to Challenge Agent

classVariable.label: Start Day of Obs Rel to Challenge Agent
classVariable.name: --CHSTDY
classVariable.notes: The actual study day of the start of an intervention or event derived relative to the first exposure to the challenge agent that induces the disease or condition that the investigational treatment is intended to c ure, mitigate, treat, or prevent. Expressed in integer days relative to RFCSTDTC in Demographics.

priorVersion.title: End Day of Obs Rel to Challenge Agent

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--CHENDY

self.title: End Day of Obs Rel to Challenge Agent

classVariable.label: End Day of Obs Rel to Challenge Agent
classVariable.name: --CHENDY
classVariable.notes: The actual study day of the end of an intervention, event, or finding derived relative to the first exposure to the challenge agent that induces the disease or condition that the investigational treatment is intended to cure, mitigate, treat, or prevent. Expressed in integer days relative to RFCSTDTC in Demographics.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--DUR

classVariable.definition: The collected length of time during which an observation continues, represented in a standardized character format.
classVariable.label: Collected Duration
classVariable.name: --DUR
classVariable.notes: Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--TPT

classVariable.definition: The description of the time when a protocol-defined activity is planned to occur, used for study data tabulation.
classVariable.label: Planned Time Point Name
classVariable.name: --TPT
classVariable.notes: This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point (e.g., time since last dose). See --TPTNUM and --TPTREF.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--TPTNUM

classVariable.definition: The numeric identifier of when an observation is planned to occur.
classVariable.label: Planned Time Point Number
classVariable.name: --TPTNUM
classVariable.notes: Used in sorting.

priorVersion.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--ELTM

self.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

classVariable.definition: The interval of time between a planned time point and a fixed reference point, represented in a standardized character format.
classVariable.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
classVariable.name: --ELTM
classVariable.notes: The fixed reference point is in --TPTREF. This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--TPTREF

classVariable.definition: The description of a time point that acts as a fixed reference for a series of planned time points, used for study data tabulation.
classVariable.label: Time Point Reference
classVariable.name: --TPTREF
classVariable.notes: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by --ELTM, --TPTNUM, --TPT, --STINT, and --ENINT.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--RFTDTC

classVariable.definition: The actual date or date and time of a time point that acts as a fixed reference for a series of planned time points, represented in a standardized character format.
classVariable.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
classVariable.name: --RFTDTC
classVariable.notes: The fixed reference point is in --TPTREF.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--STRF

classVariable.definition: The characterization of the start of an observation relative to the study reference period.
classVariable.label: Start Relative to Reference Period
classVariable.name: --STRF
classVariable.notes: The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--ENRF

classVariable.definition: The characterization of the end of an observation relative to the study reference period.
classVariable.label: End Relative to Reference Period
classVariable.name: --ENRF
classVariable.notes: The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--EVLINT

classVariable.definition: The planned time interval for which an observation is assessed, represented in a standardized character format.
classVariable.examples: -P2M to represent a period of the past 2 months as the evaluation interval for a question from a questionnaire.
classVariable.label: Evaluation Interval
classVariable.name: --EVLINT
classVariable.notes: Usually used with --DTC to describe an interval of this duration that ended at the time represented in --DTC.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--EVINTX

classVariable.definition: A textual description of the planned time interval for which an observation is assessed, where the interval is not able to be represented in a standardized character format.
classVariable.label: Evaluation Interval Text
classVariable.name: --EVINTX
classVariable.notes: A value that cannot be represented in ISO 8601 format.

priorVersion.title: Start Relative to Reference Time Point

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--STRTPT

self.title: Start Relative to Reference Time Point

classVariable.definition: The characterization of the start of an observation relative to a reference time point.
classVariable.label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point
classVariable.name: --STRTPT
classVariable.notes: The sponsor-defined reference time point is in --STTPT.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--STTPT

classVariable.definition: The description or date and/or time of a time point that acts as a fixed reference for characterizing the start of an observation.
classVariable.label: Start Reference Time Point
classVariable.name: --STTPT
classVariable.notes: This is the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by --STRTPT.

priorVersion.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--ENRTPT

self.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

classVariable.definition: The characterization of the end of an observation relative to a reference time point.
classVariable.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
classVariable.name: --ENRTPT
classVariable.notes: The sponsor-defined reference time point is in --ENTPT.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--ENTPT

classVariable.definition: The description or date and/or time of a time point that acts as a fixed reference for characterizing the end of an observation.
classVariable.label: End Reference Time Point
classVariable.name: --ENTPT
classVariable.notes: This is the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by --ENRTPT.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.MIDS

classVariable.label: Disease Milestone Instance Name
classVariable.name: MIDS
classVariable.notes: The name of a specific instance of a Disease Milestone Type (MIDSTYPE) described in the Trial Disease Milestones dataset (see Section 5.1.4.3, Trial Disease Milestones). This should be unique within a subject. Used only in conjunction with RELMIDS and MIDSDTC.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.RELMIDS

classVariable.label: Temporal Relation to Milestone Instance
classVariable.name: RELMIDS
classVariable.notes: The temporal relationship of the observation to the Disease Milestone Instance Name in MIDS.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.MIDSDTC

classVariable.label: Disease Milestone Instance Date/Time
classVariable.name: MIDSDTC
classVariable.notes: The start date/time of the Disease Milestone Instance Name in MIDS.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--STINT

classVariable.definition: The start of a planned assessment interval relative to a reference time point, represented in a standardized character format.
classVariable.label: Planned Start of Assessment Interval
classVariable.name: --STINT
classVariable.notes: The reference time point is in --TPTREF. As this variable describes planned timing of an assessment, caution should be exercised when using outside of the Findings class of domains. In an Events or Interventions domain, it may refer to the interval over which --OCCUR is assessed.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--ENINT

classVariable.definition: The end of a planned assessment interval relative to a reference time point, represented in a standardized character format.
classVariable.label: Planned End of Assessment Interval
classVariable.name: --ENINT
classVariable.notes: The reference time point is in --TPTREF. As this variable describes planned timing of an assessment, caution should be exercised when using outside of the Findings class of domains. In an Events or Interventions domain, it may refer to the interval over which --OCCUR is assessed.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--DETECT

classVariable.definition: The number of days from the start of dosing to the earliest detection of a condition or pathogen.
classVariable.label: Time in Days to Detection
classVariable.name: --DETECT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--PTFL

classVariable.label: Point in Time Flag
classVariable.name: --PTFL
classVariable.notes: An indication that the specimen was collected at a single point in time. The value is "Y" or null.
classVariable.usageRestrictions: Only in Findings class specimen-based domains: BS, CP, GF, IS, LB, MB, MS, MI, PC, PP

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--PDUR

classVariable.label: Planned Duration
classVariable.name: --PDUR
classVariable.notes: Planned duration of a finding. For a sample-based finding, this could apply to the planned duration of specimen collection.
classVariable.usageRestrictions: Only in Findings class specimen-based domains: BS, CP, GF, IS, LB, MB, MS, MI, PC, PP

class.description: The majority of observations collected during a study can be divided among three general classes: Interventions, Events, or Findings. Datasets based on any of the general observation classes share a set of common Identifier and Timing variables. As a general rule, any valid Identifier or Timing variable is permissible for use in any submission dataset based on a general observation class. (Source: SDTM v2.1, Section 3.1)
class.label: General Observations
class.name: General Observations

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--TRT

classVariable.definition: The reported name of the drug, procedure, therapy, or product.
classVariable.label: Name of Treatment or Product
classVariable.name: --TRT
classVariable.notes: The topic for the intervention observation, usually the verbatim name of the treatment, drug, medicine, therapy, or product given during the dosing interval for the observation.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--MODIFY

classVariable.definition: A value which represents an alteration to a collected value for coding purposes.
classVariable.label: Modified Treatment Name
classVariable.name: --MODIFY
classVariable.notes: If the value for --TRT is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DECOD

classVariable.definition: Standardized or dictionary-derived text for the description of an event or intervention.
classVariable.label: Standardized Treatment Name
classVariable.name: --DECOD
classVariable.notes: Equivalent to the generic drug name in WHODrug, or a term in SNOMED, ICD-9, or other published or sponsor-defined dictionaries.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--MOOD

classVariable.definition: The state that may be applied to a record to indicate its phase in a life cycle or business process (e.g., scheduled, performed).
classVariable.label: Mood
classVariable.name: --MOOD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--CAT

classVariable.definition: A grouping or classification of the topic of the finding, event, or intervention.
classVariable.label: Category
classVariable.name: --CAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--SCAT

classVariable.definition: A further grouping or classification of the category for the topic of the finding, event, or intervention.
classVariable.label: Subcategory
classVariable.name: --SCAT
classVariable.notes: The category is in --CAT.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--PRESP

classVariable.definition: An indication that the event or intervention was prospectively stated or detailed on the CRF.
classVariable.label: Pre-Specified
classVariable.name: --PRESP
classVariable.notes: Values should be "Y" or null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--OCCUR

classVariable.definition: An indication as to whether a prespecified event or intervention has occurred.
classVariable.label: Occurrence Indicator
classVariable.name: --OCCUR

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--REASOC

classVariable.label: Reason for Occur Value
classVariable.name: --REASOC
classVariable.notes: --REASOC is the reason the intervention did or did not occur, according to the value in --OCCUR. This does not replace --INDC.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--STAT

classVariable.label: Completion Status
classVariable.name: --STAT
classVariable.notes: Used to indicate when a question about the occurrence of a prespecified intervention was not answered. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--REASND

classVariable.definition: The explanation for why requested information was not available.
classVariable.label: Reason Not Done
classVariable.name: --REASND
classVariable.notes: Used in conjunction with --STAT when value is "NOT DONE".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--CNTMOD

classVariable.label: Contact Mode
classVariable.name: --CNTMOD
classVariable.notes: The way in which the event, visit, or contact was conducted.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--EPCHGI

classVariable.label: Epi/Pandemic Related Change Indicator
classVariable.name: --EPCHGI
classVariable.notes: Indicates whether the intervention was changed due to an epidemic or pandemic.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--INDC

classVariable.definition: The sign, symptom, or condition that is the basis for initiation of a treatment.
classVariable.label: Indication
classVariable.name: --INDC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--CLAS

classVariable.definition: A standardized or dictionary-derived name for a grouping of drugs, procedures, or therapies.
classVariable.label: Class
classVariable.name: --CLAS

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--CLASCD

classVariable.definition: A standardized or dictionary-derived short sequence of characters used to represent a grouping of drugs, procedures, or therapies.
classVariable.label: Class Code
classVariable.name: --CLASCD
classVariable.notes: Used to represent code for --CLAS.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DOSE

classVariable.definition: The quantity of an agent (e.g., drug, substance, radiation) taken or absorbed at a single administration.
classVariable.label: Dose
classVariable.name: --DOSE
classVariable.notes: Not populated when --DOSTXT is populated.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DOSTXT

classVariable.definition: A textual description of the quantity of an agent (e.g., drug, substance, radiation) taken or absorbed at a single administration.
classVariable.label: Dose Description
classVariable.name: --DOSTXT
classVariable.notes: Not populated when --DOSE is populated.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DOSU

classVariable.definition: The unit of measure for the administered agent (e.g., drug, substance, radiation), using standardized values.
classVariable.label: Dose Units
classVariable.name: --DOSU
classVariable.notes: Units for --DOSE, --DOSTOT, or --DOSTXT.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--TDOSD

classVariable.label: Toxic/Physiologic Dose Descr
classVariable.name: --TDOSD
classVariable.notes: A description of a statistically derived estimate of a dose with a certain toxicological or physiological effect in a population, based on data from a dose-response study.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--FTDOSD

classVariable.examples: If --TDOSD="LD50" and --FTDOSD="5", then the value represented by --DOSE and --DOSU is 5 times the LD50.
classVariable.label: Factor for Toxic/Physiologic Dose Descr
classVariable.name: --FTDOSD
classVariable.notes: The quantity given for the multiplier of --TDOSD.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DOSFRM

classVariable.definition: Physical characteristics of a product, (e.g., tablet, capsule, solution) that contains a substance, generally (but not necessarily) in association with 1 or more other ingredients.
classVariable.label: Dose Form
classVariable.name: --DOSFRM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DOSFRQ

classVariable.definition: The number of times that an agent (e.g., drug, product, substance, radiation) is administered per unit of time.
classVariable.label: Dosing Frequency per Interval
classVariable.name: --DOSFRQ

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DOSTOT

classVariable.definition: The quantity of an agent (e.g., drug, product, substance, radiation) taken or absorbed on a single day.
classVariable.label: Total Daily Dose
classVariable.name: --DOSTOT
classVariable.notes: Uses the units in --DOSU.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DOSRGM

classVariable.definition: The planned schedule for the administration of an agent (e.g., drug, product, substance, radiation).
classVariable.label: Intended Dose Regimen
classVariable.name: --DOSRGM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--ROUTE

classVariable.definition: Designation of the part of the body through which or into which, or the way in which, a substance is introduced.
classVariable.label: Route of Administration
classVariable.name: --ROUTE

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--LOT

classVariable.definition: An identifier assigned by the manufacturer or distributor to a specific quantity of manufactured material or product.
classVariable.label: Lot Number
classVariable.name: --LOT
classVariable.notes: Although the identifier for a lot is generally called a lot number, it may contain characters other than digits (e.g., letters).

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--LOC

classVariable.label: Location of Administration
classVariable.name: --LOC
classVariable.notes: Anatomical location of an intervention, such as an injection site.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--METHOD

classVariable.definition: Method of administration of the treatment.
classVariable.label: Method of Administration
classVariable.name: --METHOD
classVariable.usageRestrictions: Not in human clinical trials; EX domain only

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--LAT

classVariable.label: Laterality
classVariable.name: --LAT
classVariable.notes: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing laterality of intervention administration.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DIR

classVariable.label: Directionality
classVariable.name: --DIR
classVariable.notes: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing directionality of intervention administration.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--PORTOT

classVariable.label: Portion or Totality
classVariable.name: --PORTOT
classVariable.notes: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the distribution, which means arrangement of or apportioning of the intervention administration.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--FAST

classVariable.definition: An indication as to whether a subject has abstained from food and liquid for a prescribed amount of time.
classVariable.label: Fasting Status
classVariable.name: --FAST
classVariable.notes: Valid values include "Y", "N", "U", or null if not relevant.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--PSTRG

classVariable.definition: The amount of active ingredient per unit of pharmaceutical dosage form.
classVariable.label: Pharmaceutical Strength
classVariable.name: --PSTRG

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--PSTRGU

classVariable.definition: The unit of measure for the amount of active ingredient per unit of pharmaceutical dosage form, using standardized values.
classVariable.label: Pharmaceutical Strength Units
classVariable.name: --PSTRGU
classVariable.notes: Unit for --PSTRG.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--TRTV

classVariable.definition: A carrier or inert medium in which a medicinally active agent is administered.
classVariable.label: Treatment Vehicle
classVariable.name: --TRTV

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--VAMT

classVariable.definition: Amount of the prepared product (treatment plus vehicle) administered.
classVariable.label: Treatment Vehicle Amount
classVariable.name: --VAMT
classVariable.notes: Note: Should not be diluent amount alone.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--VAMTU

classVariable.definition: The unit of measure for the prepared product (treatment plus vehicle) using standardized values.
classVariable.label: Treatment Vehicle Amount Units
classVariable.name: --VAMTU

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--ADJ

classVariable.definition: The explanation given for why a dose was changed as compared to a previous dose.
classVariable.label: Reason for Dose Adjustment
classVariable.name: --ADJ

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--RSDISC

classVariable.label: Reason Treatment or Product Discontinued
classVariable.name: --RSDISC
classVariable.notes: Reason the treatment or product was discontinued.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--USCHFL

classVariable.definition: An indication that the performed test or observation was done at a time that was not planned.
classVariable.label: Unscheduled Flag
classVariable.name: --USCHFL
classVariable.notes: If a test or observation was performed based upon a schedule defined in the protocol, this flag should be null. Expected values are "Y" or null. This variable would not be needed when information on planned assessments is provided, such as when the Trial Visits (TV) and Subject Visits (SV) domains are used.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--RSTIND

classVariable.label: Restraint Indicator
classVariable.name: --RSTIND
classVariable.notes: An indicator as to whether the animal subject was restrained during the intervention period. Expected values are "Y" or null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--RSTMOD

classVariable.label: Restraint Mode
classVariable.name: --RSTMOD
classVariable.notes: A description of whether the restraint was physical and/or chemical.

class.description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2024-03-29)
class.label: Interventions
class.name: Interventions

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--TERM

classVariable.definition: The collected name for an event observation.
classVariable.label: Reported Term
classVariable.name: --TERM
classVariable.notes: The verbatim or prespecified name of the event.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--MODIFY

classVariable.definition: A value which represents an alteration to a collected value for coding.
classVariable.label: Modified Reported Term
classVariable.name: --MODIFY
classVariable.notes: If the value for --TERM is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--LLT

classVariable.definition: The lowest-level term assigned to the event from MedDRA.
classVariable.label: Lowest Level Term
classVariable.name: --LLT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--LLTCD

classVariable.definition: The lowest-level term code assigned to the event from MedDRA.
classVariable.label: Lowest Level Term Code
classVariable.name: --LLTCD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--DECOD

classVariable.definition: Standardized or dictionary-derived text for the description of an event or intervention.
classVariable.label: Dictionary-Derived Term
classVariable.name: --DECOD
classVariable.notes: Equivalent to the Preferred Term ("PT" in MedDRA).

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--EVDTYP

classVariable.label: Medical History Event Date Type
classVariable.name: --EVDTYP
classVariable.notes: Specifies the aspect of the medical condition or event by which MHSTDTC and/or the MHENDTC is defined.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--PTCD

classVariable.definition: The preferred term code assigned to the event from MedDRA.
classVariable.label: Preferred Term Code
classVariable.name: --PTCD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--HLT

classVariable.definition: The high-level term from the primary hierarchy assigned to the event from MedDRA.
classVariable.label: High Level Term
classVariable.name: --HLT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--HLTCD

classVariable.definition: The high-level term code from the primary hierarchy assigned to the event from MedDRA.
classVariable.label: High Level Term Code
classVariable.name: --HLTCD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--HLGT

classVariable.definition: The high-level group term from the primary hierarchy assigned to the event from MedDRA.
classVariable.label: High Level Group Term
classVariable.name: --HLGT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--HLGTCD

classVariable.definition: The high-level group term code from the primary hierarchy assigned to the event from MedDRA.
classVariable.label: High Level Group Term Code
classVariable.name: --HLGTCD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--CAT

classVariable.definition: A grouping or classification of the topic of the finding, event, or intervention.
classVariable.label: Category
classVariable.name: --CAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SCAT

classVariable.definition: A further grouping or classification of the category for the topic of the finding, event, or intervention.
classVariable.label: Subcategory
classVariable.name: --SCAT
classVariable.notes: The category is in --CAT.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--PRESP

classVariable.definition: An indication that the event or intervention was prospectively stated or detailed on the CRF.
classVariable.label: Pre-Specified
classVariable.name: --PRESP
classVariable.notes: Value is "Y" for prespecified events, null for spontaneously reported events.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--OCCUR

classVariable.definition: An indication as to whether a prespecified event or intervention has occurred.
classVariable.label: Occurrence Indicator
classVariable.name: --OCCUR

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--REASOC

classVariable.label: Reason for Occur Value
classVariable.name: --REASOC
classVariable.notes: --REASOC is the reason the event did or did not occur, according to the value in --OCCUR.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--STAT

classVariable.label: Completion Status
classVariable.name: --STAT
classVariable.notes: Used to indicate when a question about the occurrence of a prespecified event was not answered. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--REASND

classVariable.definition: The explanation for why requested information was not available.
classVariable.label: Reason Not Done
classVariable.name: --REASND
classVariable.notes: Used in conjunction with --STAT when its value is "NOT DONE".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--BODSYS

classVariable.definition: A standardized or dictionary-derived name for the body system or organ class.
classVariable.label: Body System or Organ Class
classVariable.name: --BODSYS
classVariable.notes: Body system or system organ class assigned for analysis from a standard hierarchy (e.g., MedDRA) associated with an event.

priorVersion.title: Body System or Organ Class Code

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--BDSYCD

self.title: Body System or Organ Class Code

classVariable.definition: A standardized or dictionary-derived short sequence of characters used to represent the body system or organ class.
classVariable.label: Body System or Organ Class Code
classVariable.name: --BDSYCD
classVariable.notes: MedDRA System Organ Class (SOC) code corresponding to --BODSYS assigned for analysis.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SOC

classVariable.definition: The SOC from the primary hierarchy assigned in the MedDRA dictionary.
classVariable.label: Primary System Organ Class
classVariable.name: --SOC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SOCCD

classVariable.definition: The SOC code from the primary hierarchy assigned in the MedDRA dictionary.
classVariable.label: Primary System Organ Class Code
classVariable.name: --SOCCD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--CNTMOD

classVariable.label: Contact Mode
classVariable.name: --CNTMOD
classVariable.notes: The way in which the event, visit, or contact was conducted.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--EPCHGI

classVariable.label: Epi/Pandemic Related Change Indicator
classVariable.name: --EPCHGI
classVariable.notes: Indicates whether the event was changed due to an epidemic or pandemic. Not the same as whether a medical condition was caused by an epidemic or pandemic.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--LOC

classVariable.label: Location of Event
classVariable.name: --LOC
classVariable.notes: Describes anatomical location relevant for the event.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--LAT

classVariable.label: Laterality
classVariable.name: --LAT
classVariable.notes: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing laterality.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--DIR

classVariable.label: Directionality
classVariable.name: --DIR
classVariable.notes: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing directionality.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--PORTOT

classVariable.label: Portion or Totality
classVariable.name: --PORTOT
classVariable.notes: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the distribution (i.e., arrangement of, apportioning of).

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--PARTY

classVariable.definition: The role of the individual or entity responsible for the receipt of the transferred object (e.g., device, specimen).
classVariable.label: Accountable Party
classVariable.name: --PARTY
classVariable.notes: The party could be an individual (e.g., subject), an organization (e.g., sponsor), or a location that is a proxy for an individual or organization (e.g., site). It is usually a somewhat general term that is further identified in the --PRTYID variable.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--PRTYID

classVariable.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify the individual or entity responsible for the receipt of the transferred object (e.g., device, specimen).
classVariable.label: Identification of Accountable Party
classVariable.name: --PRTYID
classVariable.notes: Used in conjunction with --PARTY.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SEV

classVariable.definition: The quality or degree of harm associated with a finding or event, as collected.
classVariable.label: Severity/Intensity
classVariable.name: --SEV

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SER

classVariable.definition: A collected indication as to whether an event meets regulatory criteria for seriousness.
classVariable.label: Serious Event
classVariable.name: --SER
classVariable.notes: Valid values are "Y" and "N".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--ACN

self.title: Action Taken w/ Study Trtmnt or Product

classVariable.definition: An action taken with study treatment or product, as the result of the event.
classVariable.label: Action Taken w/ Study Trtmnt or Product
classVariable.name: --ACN

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--ACNOTH

classVariable.definition: An action taken unrelated to study treatment or product, as the result of the event.
classVariable.label: Other Action Taken
classVariable.name: --ACNOTH

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--ACNDEV

classVariable.definition: An action taken with a device as the result of the event.
classVariable.label: Action Taken with Device
classVariable.name: --ACNDEV
classVariable.notes: The device may or may not be the device under study.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--REL

classVariable.definition: The investigator's assessment of the likelihood that the study treatment or product was the cause of the event.
classVariable.label: Causality
classVariable.name: --REL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--RLDEV

classVariable.label: Relationship of Event to Device
classVariable.name: --RLDEV
classVariable.notes: A judgment as to the likelihood that the device caused the event. \n The device may or may not be the device under study. Controlled terminology from EC Directive MEDDEV 2.7/3 March 2015 is required in EU but not US.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--RELNST

classVariable.definition: The investigator's assessment of the causal relationship of the event to a non-study treatment.
classVariable.examples: MORE LIKELY RELATED TO ASPIRIN USE
classVariable.label: Relationship to Non-Study Treatment
classVariable.name: --RELNST

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--PATT

classVariable.definition: A characterization of the temporal pattern of occurrences of the event.
classVariable.label: Pattern of Event
classVariable.name: --PATT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--OUT

classVariable.definition: The status associated with the result or conclusion of the event.
classVariable.label: Outcome of Event
classVariable.name: --OUT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SCAN

classVariable.definition: An indication as to whether the reason an event was serious was because the event was associated with cancer.
classVariable.label: Involves Cancer
classVariable.name: --SCAN
classVariable.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null. \n This is a legacy seriousness criterion. It is not included in ICH E2A or E2B.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SCONG

classVariable.definition: An indication as to whether the reason an event is serious is because the event is associated with congenital anomaly or birth defect in an offspring of the subject.
classVariable.label: Congenital Anomaly or Birth Defect
classVariable.name: --SCONG
classVariable.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SDISAB

classVariable.definition: An indication as to whether the reason an event is serious is because the event resulted in a significant, persistent, or permanent change, impairment, damage, or disruption in the subject's body function/structure, physical activities, and/or quality of life.
classVariable.label: Persist or Signif Disability/Incapacity
classVariable.name: --SDISAB
classVariable.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SDTH

classVariable.definition: An indication as to whether the reason an event is serious is because the event resulted in death.
classVariable.label: Results in Death
classVariable.name: --SDTH
classVariable.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SHOSP

classVariable.definition: An indication as to whether the reason an event is serious is because the event resulted in or prolonged hospitalization.
classVariable.label: Requires or Prolongs Hospitalization
classVariable.name: --SHOSP
classVariable.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SLIFE

classVariable.definition: An indication as to whether the reason an event is serious is because the event resulted in a substantial risk of dying.
classVariable.label: Is Life Threatening
classVariable.name: --SLIFE
classVariable.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SOD

classVariable.definition: An indication as to whether the reason an event is serious is because the event is associated with overdose.
classVariable.label: Occurred with Overdose
classVariable.name: --SOD
classVariable.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null. \n This is a legacy seriousness criterion. It is not included in ICH E2A or E2B.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SMIE

classVariable.definition: An indication as to whether the reason an event is serious is because the event may jeopardize the subject and may require intervention to prevent one of the other outcomes associated with serious adverse events.
classVariable.label: Other Medically Important Serious Event
classVariable.name: --SMIE
classVariable.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SINTV

classVariable.label: Needs Intervention to Prevent Impairment
classVariable.name: --SINTV
classVariable.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null. Expected use is in medical device-related trials. It is part of the definition of a serious AE as represented in 21 CFR Part 803.3(w)(3). \n Records whether medical or surgical intervention was necessary to preclude permanent impairment of a body function, or prevent permanent damage to a body structure, with either situation suspected to be due to the use of a medical product.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--UNANT

classVariable.label: Unanticipated Adverse Device Effect
classVariable.name: --UNANT
classVariable.notes: The assessment is about a device identified in the data (i.e., which has an SPDEVID). The device may be ancillary or under study. \n Any serious adverse effect on health or safety or any life-threatening problem or death caused by or associated with a device, if that effect, problem, or death was not previously identified in nature, severity, or degree of incidence in the investigational plan or application (including a supplementary plan or application), or any other unanticipated serious problem associated with a device that relates to the rights, safety, or welfare of subjects. (21 CFR 812.3(s)).

priorVersion.title: Rel of AE to Device-Related Procedure

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--RLPRT

self.title: Rel of AE to Non-Dev-Rel Study Activity

classVariable.label: Rel of AE to Non-Dev-Rel Study Activity
classVariable.name: --RLPRT
classVariable.notes: The investigator's opinion as to the causality of the event as related to other protocol-required activities, actions or assessments (e.g., medication changes, tests/assessments, other procedures). \n The relationship is to a protocol-specified non-device-related activity where the device is identified in the data (i.e., which has an SPDEVID). The device may be ancillary or under study.

priorVersion.title: Rel of AE to Non-Dev-Rel Study Activity

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--RLPRC

self.title: Rel of AE to Device-Related Procedure

classVariable.label: Rel of AE to Device-Related Procedure
classVariable.name: --RLPRC
classVariable.notes: The investigator's opinion as to the likelihood that the device-related study procedure caused the AE (e.g., implant/insertion, revision/adjustment, explant/removal) \n The relationship is to a device-related procedure where the device is identified in the data (i.e., which has an SPDEVID). The device may be ancillary or under study.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--CONTRT

classVariable.definition: An indication as to whether a non-study treatment was given because of the occurrence of the event.
classVariable.label: Concomitant or Additional Trtmnt Given
classVariable.name: --CONTRT
classVariable.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--TOX

classVariable.definition: The standardized or dictionary-derived name for an untoward event or finding.
classVariable.label: Toxicity
classVariable.name: --TOX
classVariable.notes: Sponsor should specify which scale and version is used in the Sponsor Comments column of the Define-XML document.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--TOXGR

classVariable.definition: A categorical classification of the severity of an event or finding, based on a standard scale, used in study data tabulation.
classVariable.examples: A toxicity grade from the NCI CTCAE.
classVariable.label: Toxicity Grade
classVariable.name: --TOXGR
classVariable.notes: Sponsor should specify which scale and version is used in the Sponsor Comments column of the Define-XML document.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--USCHFL

classVariable.definition: An indication that the performed test or observation was done at a time that was not planned.
classVariable.label: Unscheduled Flag
classVariable.name: --USCHFL
classVariable.notes: If a test or observation was performed based upon a schedule defined in the protocol, this flag should be null. Expected values are "Y" or null. This variable would not be needed when information on planned assessments is provided, such as when the Trial Visits (TV) and Subject Visits (SV) domains are used.

class.description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2024-03-29)
class.label: Events
class.name: Events

priorVersion.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--TESTCD

self.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

classVariable.definition: The standardized or dictionary-derived short sequence of characters used to represent the measurement, test, or examination.
classVariable.label: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam
classVariable.name: --TESTCD
classVariable.notes: Used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. The short value can be up to 8 characters.

priorVersion.title: Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

qualifiesVariable.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--TEST

self.title: Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

classVariable.definition: The standardized or dictionary-derived name of the measurement, test, or examination.
classVariable.label: Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam
classVariable.name: --TEST

qualifiesVariable.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--SBMRKS

classVariable.examples: Three unnamed sublineages of monocytes have been identified: CCR2+CD16-; CCR2-CD16+; and CCR2+CD16+. Whereas the entire monocyte cell population can be defined as CD14+ cells, the additional CCR2 and CD16 markers are used to differentiate one sublineage from another, none of which has yet been given a name by the scientific community. By combining the CPTEST value of "Monocyte Subset" with the value of "CCR2+CD16-" in CPSBMRKS, the full test is defined to be the CCR2+CD16- monocyte subpopulation.
classVariable.label: Sublineage Marker String
classVariable.name: --SBMRKS
classVariable.notes: Used to further subset the cell population identified in CPTEST based on the use of additional marker(s) that define a sublineage. The value in CPSBMRKS is used in combination with values in CPTEST and CPCELSTA to fully describe the cell population being measured. As such, it is an essential component of the full test name.

qualifiesVariable.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--CELSTA

classVariable.label: Cell State
classVariable.name: --CELSTA
classVariable.notes: A textual description of a subset of the cell population identified in CPTEST based on a particular functional and/or biological state (e.g., primed, activated, proliferating, senescent, G2-arrested). When populated, the values in CPCELSTA and CPSMRKS, in combination with values in CPTEST and CPSBMRKS, fully describe the cell population being measured.

qualifiesVariable.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--CSMRKS

classVariable.examples: When Ki67 expression is used to determine that a cell population is in a proliferating state (i.e., CPCELSTA value = "PROLIFERATING"), the value "Ki67+" in CPCSMRKS indicates that positive expression of Ki67 was used to define the population as proliferating. Similarly, a value of "Ki67-" in CPCSMRKS would indicate that lack of expression of Ki67 defined the "NON-PROLIFERATING" cell state in CPCELSTA. The CPCSMRKS value is useful for quickly determining which marker(s) were used to classify (i.e., operationally define) a cell population based on a functional/biological state.
classVariable.label: Cell State Marker String
classVariable.name: --CSMRKS
classVariable.notes: Identifies the marker(s) or indicator(s) used to define the cell state (i.e., the value in CPCELSTA).

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--CNTMOD

classVariable.label: Contact Mode
classVariable.name: --CNTMOD
classVariable.notes: The way in which the measurement, test, or examination was conducted.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--EPCHGI

classVariable.label: Epi/Pandemic Related Change Indicator
classVariable.name: --EPCHGI
classVariable.notes: Indicates whether the measurement, test, or examination was changed due to an epidemic or pandemic.

qualifiesVariable.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--TSTCND

classVariable.examples: Stimulating or activating agents, assay temperature, incubation time \n "STIMULATED", "NON-STIMULATED", "25 C", "37 C".
classVariable.label: Test Condition
classVariable.name: --TSTCND
classVariable.notes: Identifies any planned condition imposed by the assay system on the specimen at the time the test is performed.
classVariable.usageRestrictions: CP, IS, and LB domains only

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--CNDAGT

classVariable.examples: "Phorbol myristate acetate", "Concanavalin A, PHA-P", "TNF-alpha, Ionomycin", "Candida antigen"
classVariable.label: Test Condition Agent
classVariable.name: --CNDAGT
classVariable.notes: The textual description of the agent used to impose a test condition identified in CPTSTCND. For example, records might be produced for the same test run under stimulating (CPTSTCND value = "STIMULATED") conditions produced by different stimulating agents.
classVariable.usageRestrictions: CP, IS, and LB domains only

qualifiesVariable.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--BDAGNT

classVariable.label: Binding Agent
classVariable.name: --BDAGNT
classVariable.notes: The textual description of the agent that's binding to the entity in the --TEST variable. The --BDAGNT variable is used to indicate that there is a binding relationship between the entities in the --TEST and --BDAGNT variables, regardless of direction.--BDAGNT is not a method qualifier. It should only be used when the actual interest of the measurement is the binding interaction between the two entities in --TEST and --BDAGNT. In other words, the combination of --TEST and --BDAGNT should describe the thing, the entity, or the analyte being measured, without the need for additional variables. \n The binding agent may be, but is not limited to, a test article, a portion of the test article, a related compound, an endogenous molecule, an allergen, or an infectious agent.
classVariable.usageRestrictions: CP, IS, and LB domains only

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--ABCLID

classVariable.label: Antibody Clone Identifier
classVariable.name: --ABCLID
classVariable.notes: Identifies the antibody clone (e.g., supplier-provided catalog name) used to confer specificity for the binding agent specified in CPBDAGNT.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--MRKSTR

classVariable.label: Marker String
classVariable.name: --MRKSTR
classVariable.notes: The text string identifying the full set of markers/indicators used by the laboratory to operationally define the complete test. Because laboratories often use different markers/indicators to identify a cell population, the relationship between a named cell population in CPTEST (as combined with CPSBMRKS and CPCELSTA values) and the set of markers used to identify that population is many-to-one. To ensure nuances important for accurately interpreting the data are accounted for and which arise from the use of different sets of markers, it is necessary to operationally define the test in terms of the markers/indicators used to perform that test.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--GATE

classVariable.label: Gate
classVariable.name: --GATE
classVariable.notes: The sponsor-defined name assigned to a gate. Gates are electronic (device setting or software-defined) boundaries set by a user to virtually parse a specimen into discrete populations based on a set of defined characteristics (e.g., presence, absence, or intensity of expression of various markers; physical size; internal complexity or granularity). Gates are used to constrain data collection or analysis to a specific cell population or region of interest within the specimen.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--GATDEF

classVariable.label: Gate Definition
classVariable.name: --GATDEF
classVariable.notes: The text string identifying the set of parameters and the order in which they are applied to define the gating strategy. In practice, a series of 2-dimensional subgates based on 2 different cell characteristics (i.e., markers/indicators/physical properties) are most often combined until the cell population of interest is sufficiently resolved (i.e., electronically isolated) from other cell populations contained within the specimen. \n For complex analyses, differences in gating strategies can produce subtle differences in results obtained for a test. To ensure nuances important for accurately interpreting the data are accounted for and which arise from the use of different gating strategies, it is often necessary to qualify the test in terms of the gating strategy. For some purposes, however, and at the discretion of the sponsor, only the ultimate or penultimate gate is identified. When specifying the gating strategy in CPGATDEF, each subgate should be listed in the order it was applied and separated from the next sub-gate using the vertical line or pipe character ("|").

qualifiesVariable.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--TSTOPO

classVariable.label: Test Operational Objective
classVariable.name: --TSTOPO
classVariable.notes: The textual description of the high-level purpose of the test at the operational level.

qualifiesVariable.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--MSCBCE

classVariable.label: Molecule Secreted by Cells
classVariable.name: --MSCBCE
classVariable.notes: The textual description of the entity secreted by the cells represented in --TEST. The combination of --TEST and --MSBCE should describe the thing, the entity, or the analyte being measured, without the need for additional variables.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--AGENT

classVariable.label: Agent Name
classVariable.name: --AGENT
classVariable.notes: The name of the drug or other material for which resistance is tested. The agent may be used for in vitro testing or may be used in tests for genetic markers or in direct phenotypic drug-sensitivity testing.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--CONC

classVariable.label: Agent Concentration
classVariable.name: --CONC
classVariable.notes: The amount of drug or other material listed in MSAGENT per unit volume or weight. Used when the agent is part of the prespecified test. Not to be used when the concentration is a result of a test such as minimal inhibitory concentration, IC50, or EC50.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--CONCU

classVariable.label: Agent Concentration Units
classVariable.name: --CONCU
classVariable.notes: Unit of measure for MSCONC.

qualifiesVariable.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--MODIFY

classVariable.definition: A value which represents an alteration to a collected value for coding purposes.
classVariable.label: Modified Result Term
classVariable.name: --MODIFY

qualifiesVariable.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--TSTDTL

classVariable.examples: STAINING INTENSITY when MITEST="Human Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor 2"
classVariable.label: Measurement, Test, or Examination Detail
classVariable.name: --TSTDTL
classVariable.notes: Further description of --TESTCD and --TEST.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--SPTSTD

classVariable.label: Sponsor Test Description
classVariable.name: --SPTSTD
classVariable.notes: Sponsor's description of a test. This variable is particularly valuable for identifying the cell population on which certain tests are conducted when it is not identified in the Test Name (CPTEST; e.g., tests for quantitative expression of a particular marker).

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--CAT

classVariable.definition: A grouping or classification of the topic of the finding, event, or intervention.
classVariable.label: Category
classVariable.name: --CAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--SCAT

classVariable.definition: A further grouping or classification of the category for the topic of the finding, event, or intervention.
classVariable.label: Subcategory
classVariable.name: --SCAT
classVariable.notes: The category is in --CAT.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--TSTPNL

classVariable.label: Test Panel
classVariable.name: --TSTPNL
classVariable.notes: Sponsor-defined textual description used to group tests run together as part of a test panel. Can be used with --GRPID to ensure that relationships between associated tests are accurately identified.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--POS

classVariable.label: Position of Subject During Observation
classVariable.name: --POS

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--BODSYS

classVariable.name: --BODSYS

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--COLSRT

classVariable.label: Collected Summary Result Type
classVariable.name: --COLSRT
classVariable.notes: Used to indicate the type of a collected summary result. This is used for summary results collected on a CRF or provided by an external vendor (e.g., central lab). \n If the summary result is derived by the sponsor using individual source data records, the summary result is represented in ADaM. If a sponsor has both a collected or vendor-provided summary result and a derived summary result, the collected or vendor-provided summary result is represented in SDTM and the derived summary result is represented in ADaM.

self.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

classVariable.definition: The standardized result of the measurement, test, or examination, in character format.
classVariable.examples: If various tests have results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in --ORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in --STRESC as "NEGATIVE".
classVariable.label: Result or Finding in Standard Format
classVariable.name: --STRESC
classVariable.notes: --STRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in --STRESN.
