classVariable.name: --FAST
classVariable.notes: Valid values include "Y", "N", "U", or null if not relevant.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--DRVFL

classVariable.definition: An indication that the measurement or finding is not a collected value but is processed or computed by the sponsor from collected data.
classVariable.examples: The average of other records used as a computed baseline.
classVariable.label: Derived Flag
classVariable.name: --DRVFL
classVariable.notes: Should be "Y" or null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--EVAL

classVariable.definition: The role of the person(s) providing an evaluation, appraisal, or interpretation.
classVariable.label: Evaluator
classVariable.name: --EVAL
classVariable.notes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group).
classVariable.usageRestrictions: Not in QS, FT, and clinical classifications use case of RS

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--EVALID

classVariable.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify the evaluator(s).
classVariable.label: Evaluator Identifier
classVariable.name: --EVALID
classVariable.notes: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in --EVAL.
classVariable.usageRestrictions: Not in QS, FT, and clinical classifications use case of RS

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--ACPTFL

classVariable.definition: An indication that a record is the endorsed assessment.
classVariable.label: Accepted Record Flag
classVariable.name: --ACPTFL
classVariable.notes: Expected values can include "Y", "N", or null. This is not intended to be an analysis flag to indicate acceptability for a given analysis.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--TOX

classVariable.definition: The standardized or dictionary-derived name for an untoward event or finding.
classVariable.label: Toxicity
classVariable.name: --TOX
classVariable.notes: Sponsors should specify which scale and version is used in the Sponsor Comments column of the Define-XML document.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--TOXGR

classVariable.definition: A categorical classification of the severity of an event or finding, based on a standard scale, used in study data tabulation.
classVariable.examples: A grade from the NCI CTCAE. \n "2"
classVariable.label: Toxicity Grade
classVariable.name: --TOXGR
classVariable.notes: Sponsors should specify which scale and version is used in the Sponsor Comments column of the Define-XML document.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--SEV

classVariable.definition: The quality or degree of harm associated with a finding or event, as collected.
classVariable.label: Severity/Intensity
classVariable.name: --SEV

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--CLSIG

classVariable.definition: An indication as to whether an observation is clinically significant based on judgment.
classVariable.label: Clinically Significant, Collected
classVariable.name: --CLSIG
classVariable.notes: For collected assessments of clinical significance of a result.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--DTHREL

classVariable.definition: An indication that a particular finding is related to the cause of death.
classVariable.label: Relationship to Death
classVariable.name: --DTHREL

qualifiesVariable.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--LLOQ

classVariable.definition: The lowest threshold for reliably quantifying the amount of substance measured by a specific test, in standardized units.
classVariable.label: Lower Limit of Quantitation
classVariable.name: --LLOQ
classVariable.notes: Units will be those used for --STRESU.

qualifiesVariable.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--ULOQ

classVariable.definition: The highest threshold for reliably detecting the result of a specific test in standardized units.
classVariable.label: Upper Limit of Quantitation
classVariable.name: --ULOQ
classVariable.notes: Units will be those used for --STRESU.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--REASPF

classVariable.definition: The explanation for why a test, measurement, or assessment is executed.
classVariable.label: Reason Test Performed
classVariable.name: --REASPF

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--EXCLFL

classVariable.definition: An indication that the result is to be excluded from all calculations.
classVariable.label: Exclude from Statistics
classVariable.name: --EXCLFL
classVariable.notes: Expected to be "Y" or null. --EXCLFL should be null when --STAT is "NOT DONE".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--REASEX

classVariable.definition: The explanation for why a result is excluded from all calculations.
classVariable.label: Reason for Exclusion from Statistics
classVariable.name: --REASEX
classVariable.notes: Used in conjunction with --EXCLFL when its value is "Y".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--USCHFL

classVariable.definition: An indication that the performed test or observation was done at a time that was not planned.
classVariable.label: Unscheduled Flag
classVariable.name: --USCHFL
classVariable.notes: If a test or observation was performed based upon a schedule defined in the protocol, this flag should be null. Expected values are "Y" or null. This variable would not be needed when information on planned assessments is provided, such as when the Trial Visits (TV) and Subject Visits (SV) domains are used.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--REPNUM

classVariable.examples: Multiple measurements of blood pressure or multiple analyses of a sample.
classVariable.label: Repetition Number
classVariable.name: --REPNUM
classVariable.notes: The instance number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point or within a visit).

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--RSTIND

classVariable.label: Restraint Indicator
classVariable.name: --RSTIND
classVariable.notes: An indicator as to whether the animal was restrained during the observation period. Expected values are "Y" or null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--RSTMOD

classVariable.label: Restraint Mode
classVariable.name: --RSTMOD
classVariable.notes: A description of whether the restraint was physical and/or chemical.

class.description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2024-03-29)
class.label: Findings
class.name: Findings

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable FindingsAbout.--OBJ

classVariable.examples: An event of vomiting which has findings, where --OBJ="VOMIT" and the volume of VOMIT is being measured where --TESTCD="VOLUME".
classVariable.label: Object of the Observation
classVariable.name: --OBJ
classVariable.notes: Used in domains modeled as Findings About Events or Findings About Interventions. Describes the event or intervention whose property is being measured in --TESTCD/--TEST.

class.description: This SDTM class is a specialization of the findings general observation class. It is intended, as its name implies, to be used when collected data represent findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an event or intervention record or as a supplemental qualifier to such a record. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C135396, 2024-03-29)
class.label: Findings About
class.name: Findings About

dataset.datasetStructure: One record per subject

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.STUDYID

datasetVariable.definition: A sequence of characters used by the sponsor to uniquely identify the study.
datasetVariable.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariable.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.DOMAIN

datasetVariable.definition: An abbreviation for a collection of observations, with a topic-specific commonality.
datasetVariable.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariable.name: DOMAIN
datasetVariable.notes: 2-character abbreviation, which must be "DM".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.USUBJID

datasetVariable.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
datasetVariable.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariable.name: USUBJID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.SUBJID

datasetVariable.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
datasetVariable.name: SUBJID
datasetVariable.notes: Subject identifier, which must be unique within the study. Often the ID of the subject as recorded on a CRF.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.RFSTDTC

datasetVariable.definition: The start date or date and time of the sponsor-defined study reference period, represented in a standardized character format.
datasetVariable.label: Subject Reference Start Date/Time
datasetVariable.name: RFSTDTC
datasetVariable.notes: Usually equivalent to date/time when subject was first exposed to study treatment or product. Required for all randomized subjects; will be null for all subjects who did not meet the milestone the date requires, such as screen failures or unassigned subjects.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.RFENDTC

datasetVariable.definition: The end date or date and time of the sponsor-defined study reference period, represented in a standardized character format.
datasetVariable.label: Subject Reference End Date/Time
datasetVariable.name: RFENDTC
datasetVariable.notes: Usually equivalent to the date/time when a subject was determined to have ended the trial. Often equivalent to either date/time of last exposure to study treatment or product or date/time of last contact with the subject. Required for all randomized subjects; null for screen failures or unassigned subjects.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.RFXSTDTC

datasetVariable.definition: The start date or date and time of the first exposure to any protocol-specified treatment, therapy, or product represented in a standardized character format.
datasetVariable.label: Date/Time of First Study Exposure
datasetVariable.name: RFXSTDTC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.RFXENDTC

datasetVariable.definition: The end date or date and time of the last exposure to any protocol-specified treatment, therapy, or product represented in a standardized character format.
datasetVariable.label: Date/Time of Last Study Exposure
datasetVariable.name: RFXENDTC

priorVersion.title: Date/Time of First Challenge Agent Admin

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.RFCSTDTC

self.title: Date/Time of First Challenge Agent Admin

datasetVariable.label: Date/Time of First Challenge Agent Admin
datasetVariable.name: RFCSTDTC
datasetVariable.notes: The start date or date and time of the first exposure to any protocol-specified challenge agent that induces the disease or condition that the investigational treatment is intended to cure, mitigate, treat, or prevent, represented in a standardized character format. \n Equal to the earliest value of AGSTDTC for the challenge agent.

priorVersion.title: Date/Time of Last Challenge Agent Admin

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.RFCENDTC

self.title: Date/Time of Last Challenge Agent Admin

datasetVariable.label: Date/Time of Last Challenge Agent Admin
datasetVariable.name: RFCENDTC
datasetVariable.notes: The end date or date and time of the last exposure to any protocol-specified challenge agent that induces the disease or condition that the investigational treatment is intended to cure, mitigate, treat, or prevent, represented in a standardized character format. \n Equal to the latest value of AGENDTC for the challenge agent.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.RFICDTC

datasetVariable.definition: The date or date and time of informed consent, represented in a standardized character format.
datasetVariable.label: Date/Time of Informed Consent
datasetVariable.name: RFICDTC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.RFPENDTC

datasetVariable.definition: The date or date and time of last contact with or information about a subject in a trial, represented in a standardized character format.
datasetVariable.label: Date/Time of End of Participation
datasetVariable.name: RFPENDTC
datasetVariable.notes: Should correspond to the last known date of contact.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.DTHDTC

datasetVariable.definition: The date or date and time of death, represented in a standardized character format.
datasetVariable.label: Date/Time of Death
datasetVariable.name: DTHDTC
datasetVariable.notes: Should represent the date/time that is captured in the clinical-trial database.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.DTHFL

datasetVariable.definition: An indication that the subject died.
datasetVariable.label: Subject Death Flag
datasetVariable.name: DTHFL
datasetVariable.notes: A value of "Y" indicates the subject died. Should be "Y" or null. Should be populated even when the death date is unknown.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.SITEID

datasetVariable.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify the facility associated with study-specific activities.
datasetVariable.label: Study Site Identifier
datasetVariable.name: SITEID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.INVID

datasetVariable.label: Investigator Identifier
datasetVariable.name: INVID
datasetVariable.notes: An identifier to describe the Investigator for the study. May be used in addition to the SITEID. Not needed if SITEID is equivalent to INVID.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.INVNAM

datasetVariable.label: Investigator Name
datasetVariable.name: INVNAM
datasetVariable.notes: Name of the investigator for a site.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.BRTHDTC

datasetVariable.definition: The date or date and time of birth, represented in a standardized character format.
datasetVariable.label: Date/Time of Birth
datasetVariable.name: BRTHDTC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.AGE

datasetVariable.definition: A numeric representation of the elapsed time since birth at a specific point in time defined for the trial, used for study data tabulation.
datasetVariable.label: Age
datasetVariable.name: AGE
datasetVariable.notes: May be derived as (RFSTDTC-BRTHDTC), but BRTHDTC may not be available in all cases (due to subject privacy concerns).

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.AGETXT

datasetVariable.definition: The age at a specific point in time defined for the trial, expressed as a range.
datasetVariable.label: Age Text
datasetVariable.name: AGETXT
datasetVariable.notes: The age of the subject at study start, as planned, expressed as a range. If an age integer value is available, then populate the age variable instead. Either the AGE or AGETXT variable should be populated, but not both.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.AGEU

datasetVariable.definition: The unit of time used to express the age, using standardized values.
datasetVariable.label: Age Units
datasetVariable.name: AGEU

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.SEX

datasetVariable.label: Sex
datasetVariable.name: SEX
datasetVariable.notes: Sex of the subject.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.RACE

datasetVariable.label: Race
datasetVariable.name: RACE
datasetVariable.notes: Race of the subject. Sponsors should refer to FDA guidance regarding the collection of race data.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.ETHNIC

datasetVariable.label: Ethnicity
datasetVariable.name: ETHNIC
datasetVariable.notes: The ethnicity of the subject. Sponsors should refer to FDA guidance regarding the collection of ethnicity data.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.SPECIES

datasetVariable.definition: The common (non-taxonomic) name for an animal used as the test system in a study.
datasetVariable.label: Species
datasetVariable.name: SPECIES

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.STRAIN

datasetVariable.definition: The vendor-supplied species/strain/substrain designation for the test system under study. It may combine the species, background strain, substrain, and associated genetic modifications as supplied by the vendor (e.g. FISCHER 344, SPRAGUE-DAWLEY IGS, WISTAR Kyoto, BEAGLE, CYNOMOLGUS, RHESUS, CHIMPANZEE).
datasetVariable.label: Strain/Substrain
datasetVariable.name: STRAIN

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.SBSTRAIN

datasetVariable.definition: Additional clarifying details regarding the test system under study, such as a description of a phenotypic alteration associated with the specific genetic modification captured or collected in the Strain/Substrain variable.
datasetVariable.label: Strain/Substrain Details
datasetVariable.name: SBSTRAIN

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.ARMCD

datasetVariable.definition: A short sequence of characters that represents the planned arm to which the subject was assigned.
datasetVariable.label: Planned Arm Code
datasetVariable.name: ARMCD
datasetVariable.notes: Limited to 20 characters.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.ARM

datasetVariable.definition: The name of the planned arm to which the subject was assigned.
datasetVariable.label: Description of Planned Arm
datasetVariable.name: ARM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.ACTARMCD

datasetVariable.definition: A short sequence of characters that represents the arm in which the subject actually participated.
datasetVariable.label: Actual Arm Code
datasetVariable.name: ACTARMCD
datasetVariable.notes: Limited to 20 characters.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.ACTARM

datasetVariable.definition: The name of the arm in which the subject actually participated.
datasetVariable.label: Description of Actual Arm
datasetVariable.name: ACTARM

datasetVariable.label: Reason Arm and/or Actual Arm is Null
datasetVariable.name: ARMNRS
datasetVariable.notes: The reason why the actual arm variables are null or why both the planned and actual arm variables are null. It is assumed that if the arm and actual arm variables are null, the same reason applies to both.

datasetVariable.label: Description of Unplanned Actual Arm
datasetVariable.name: ACTARMUD
datasetVariable.notes: A description of actual treatment or product for a subject who did not receive treatment or the product described in one of the planned trial arms.

datasetVariable.label: Set Code
datasetVariable.name: SETCD
datasetVariable.notes: Defined by the sponsor (see Section 5.1.2, Trial Sets). Maximum of 8 characters. This represents the code for the trial set for which parameters are being submitted.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.RPATHCD

datasetVariable.definition: A short sequence of characters that represents the planned reproductive path to which the subject was assigned.
datasetVariable.label: Planned Repro Path Code
datasetVariable.name: RPATHCD
datasetVariable.notes: Limited to 20 characters.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.COUNTRY

datasetVariable.definition: The country in which the investigational site is located.
datasetVariable.label: Country
datasetVariable.name: COUNTRY

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.DMDTC

datasetVariable.definition: The date or date and time of demographic data collection, represented in a standardized character format.
datasetVariable.label: Date/Time of Collection
datasetVariable.name: DMDTC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.DMDY

datasetVariable.definition: The actual study day of demographic data collection derived relative to the sponsor-defined reference start date.
datasetVariable.label: Study Day of Collection
datasetVariable.name: DMDY
datasetVariable.notes: The sponsor-defined reference start date is RFSTDTC.

dataset.description: A special-purpose domain that includes a set of essential standard variables that describe each subject in a clinical or nonclinical study. One record will exist for each subject. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C66734 2024-03-29)

class.description: Associated persons are individuals other than study subjects who can be associated with a study, a particular study subject, or a device used in the study. The structures of SDTM datasets that represent data about associated persons are based on the structures for data about study subjects, either general observation class structures or special-purpose domain structures. AP domains are created using SDTM variables, with the application of specific AP rules. (Source: SDTM v2.1, Section 4)
class.label: Associated Persons
class.name: Associated Persons

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TD.TDNUMRPT

datasetVariable.notes: This variable must represent the maximum number of actual assessments for the analysis that this disease assessment schedule describes. In a trial where the maximum number of assessments is not defined explicitly in the protocol (e.g., assessments occur until death), TDNUMRPT should represent the maximum number of disease assessments that support the efficacy analysis, encountered by any subject across the trial at that point in time.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.RFENDTC

datasetVariable.name: RFENDTC
datasetVariable.notes: Usually equivalent to the date/time when a subject was determined to have ended the trial. Often equivalent to either date/time of last exposure to study treatment or product or date/time of last contact with the subject. Required for all randomized subjects; null for screen failures or unassigned subjects.

datasetVariable.notes: Identifier for a related subject or pool of subjects. RSUBJID may be populated with the USUBJID of the related subject or the POOLID of the related pool. \n RSUBJID will be null for data about associated persons who are related to the study but not to any study subjects.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable APRELSUB.RDEVID

datasetVariable.label: Related Device Identifier
datasetVariable.name: RDEVID
datasetVariable.notes: Identifier for a related device. RDEVID will be populated with the SPDEVID of the related device.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable APRELSUB.SREL

datasetVariable.label: Subject, Device, or Study Relationship
datasetVariable.name: SREL
datasetVariable.notes: If RSUBJID is populated, describes the relationship of the associated person(s) identified in APID to the subject or pool identified in RSUBJID. \n If RDEVID is populated, describes the relationship of the associated person(s) identified in APID to the subject or pool identified in RDEVID. \n If RSUBJID and RDEVID are null, SREL describes the relationship of the associated person(s) identified in APID to the study identified in STUDYID.

dataset.description: A dataset used to represent relationships between associated persons (individuals who are not study subjects, but about whom data is collected) and study subjects. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C66734 2024-03-29)
dataset.label: Associated Persons Related to Subjects
dataset.name: APRELSUB

dataset.datasetStructure: One record per specimen identifier per subject

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable RELSPEC.STUDYID

datasetVariable.definition: A sequence of characters used by the sponsor to uniquely identify the study.
datasetVariable.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariable.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable RELSPEC.USUBJID

datasetVariable.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
datasetVariable.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariable.name: USUBJID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable RELSPEC.REFID

datasetVariable.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify a source of information.
datasetVariable.label: Reference ID
datasetVariable.name: REFID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable RELSPEC.SPEC

datasetVariable.definition: The type of sample material taken from a biological entity.
datasetVariable.label: Specimen Type
datasetVariable.name: SPEC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable RELSPEC.PARENT

datasetVariable.label: Specimen Parent
datasetVariable.name: PARENT
datasetVariable.notes: Identifies the REFID of the parent of a specimen to support tracking its genealogy.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable RELSPEC.LEVEL

datasetVariable.label: Specimen Level
datasetVariable.name: LEVEL
datasetVariable.notes: Identifies the generation number of the sample where the collected sample is considered the first generation.

dataset.description: A dataset used to represent relationships between specimens. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C66734 2024-03-29)
dataset.label: Related Specimens
dataset.name: RELSPEC

product.name: SDTM v2.1
